title: Broken MIR in DefId(...): equate_normalized_input_or_output: `...` failed with `NoSolution`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(generic_associated_types)] pub trait BorrowedHandle { type Handle<'s, T> where T: 'static; } pub struct Owned where O: 'static, T: 'static, H: BorrowedHandle, { _owner: &'static O, _borrow: H::Handle<'static, T>, } impl Owned where H: BorrowedHandle, { pub fn new(_: O, _: fn(&O) -> H::Handle<'_, T>) -> Self { todo!() } } struct PrimRef; impl BorrowedHandle for PrimRef { type Handle<'s, T> where T: 'static, = &'s T; } type OwnedRef = Owned<(T,), T, PrimRef>; pub fn test() { let _: OwnedRef = Owned::new((42,), |v| &v.0); // < ERROR } ``` [playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9a86a921f8e11054e77f0ca8ffe0f05b) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (e3b1c12be 2021-08-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: e3b1c12becebd21d88ca9f4364d7db8d1d380c18 commit-date: 2021-08-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` > cargo build warning: Error finalizing incremental compilation session directory `/home/kimundi/projects/owning-ref-v2/target/debug/incremental/owning_ref_v2-234z64y4zgjj7/s-g13xkykhvy-vzm7mr-working`: No such file or directory (os error 2) error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:27 ~ owning_ref_v2[893f]::test::{closure#0}) (bb0[0]): equate_normalized_input_or_output: `&[closure@src/lib.rs:40:45: 40:53]==&[closure@src/lib.rs:40:45: 40:53]` failed with `NoSolution` --> src/lib.rs:40:53 | 40 | let _: OwnedRef = Owned::new((42,), |v| &v.0); | ^ | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_mir/src/borrow_check/type_check/mod.rs:299:27 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1050:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0-nightly (e3b1c12be 2021-08-02) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack warning: `owning-ref-v2` (lib) generated 1 warning error: could not compile `owning-ref-v2`; 1 warning emitted ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1050:13 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/e3b1c12becebd21d88ca9f4364d7db8d1d380c18/library/std/src/panicking.rs:516:5 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at /rustc/e3b1c12becebd21d88ca9f4364d7db8d1d380c18/library/std/src/panicking.rs:458:5 2: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::flush_delayed 3: ::drop 4: core::ptr::drop_in_place 5: as core::ops::drop::Drop>::drop 6: core::ptr::drop_in_place 7: rustc_span::with_source_map 8: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 9: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```
